section.title: Create a Java EE Web Project Using JBoss Central
section.para: The TicketMonster application is based on a Java EE web application. A wizard is provided for creating this type of project in JBoss Central and the procedure below guides you through the wizard.

procedure.title: Create a Web Application Using the Java EE Web Project Wizard

step.para: Click the JBoss Central tab. If the JBoss Central tab is not visible, click Help→JBoss Central.
Under Create Projects, click Java EE Web Project to open the Java EE Web Project wizard.
From the Target Runtime list, select JBoss EAP 6.0 Runtime and click Next.
In the Project name field, type ticket-monster.
In the Package field, type org.jboss.jdf.example.ticketmonster and click Next.

In the Properties available from archetype table, select the Value field corresponding to jboss-bom-enterprise-version and edit it to contain 1.0.2.Final-redhat-1. This value indicates the bill of materials (BOM) and specifies which versions of dependencies to include in the project.
Click Finish to create the project.

During project creation, the wizard imports project dependencies. When the Java EE Web Project wizard displays 'Java EE Web Project' Project is now ready, click Finish to close the wizard. A readme file for the project will automatically be opened for viewing.
